t: Job 10
My*p soul is weary of my life; I will leave my complaint upon myself; I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.
I*p will say unto God, Do not condemn me; shew me wherefore thou contendest with me.
Is*p it good unto thee that thou shouldest oppress, that thou shouldest despise the work of thine hands, and shine upon the counsel of the wicked?
Hast*p thou eyes of flesh? or seest thou as man seeth?
Are*p thy days as the days of man? are thy years as man's days,
That*p thou enquirest after mine iniquity, and searchest after my sin?
Thou*p knowest that I am not wicked; and there is none that can deliver out of thine hand.
Thine*p hands have made me and fashioned me together round about; yet thou dost destroy me.
Remember,*p I beseech thee, that thou hast made me as the clay; and wilt thou bring me into dust again?
Hast*p thou not poured me out as milk, and curdled me like cheese?
Thou*p hast clothed me with skin and flesh, and hast fenced me with bones and sinews.
Thou*p hast granted me life and favour, and thy visitation hath preserved my spirit.
And*p these things hast thou hid in thine heart: I know that this is with thee.
If*p I sin, then thou markest me, and thou wilt not acquit me from mine iniquity.
If*p I be wicked, woe unto me; and if I be righteous, yet will I not lift up my head. I am full of confusion; therefore see thou mine affliction;
For*p it increaseth. Thou huntest me as a fierce lion: and again thou shewest thyself marvellous upon me.
Thou*p renewest thy witnesses against me, and increasest thine indignation upon me; changes and war are against me.
Wherefore*p then hast thou brought me forth out of the womb? Oh that I had given up the ghost, and no eye had seen me!
I*p should have been as though I had not been; I should have been carried from the womb to the grave.
Are*p not my days few? cease then, and let me alone, that I may take comfort a little,
Before*p I go whence I shall not return, even to the land of darkness and the shadow of death;
A*p land of darkness, as darkness itself; and of the shadow of death, without any order, and where the light is as darkness.
